item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

ok I want it so when you click on a hyperlink it will go through some function. I got this:

<script type="text/javascript">

function addEvent(obj, evType, fn, useCapture) {
	if(obj.addEventListener) {
		obj.addEventListener(evType, fn, useCapture);
		return true;
	} else if(obj.attachEvent) {
		var r = obj.attachEvent("on" + evType, fn);
		return r;
	} else {
		alert("Handler could not be created");
	}
}
function listenHyperlinks() {
	var links = document.getElementsByTagName("a");
	for(i = 0; i < links.length; i++) {
		addEvent(links[i], "click", linkHandler);
	}
}

function linkHandler(event) {
	alert(event);
	
}

listenHyperlinks();
</script>

but it doensâ€™t work :/, any help?

thanks ~barluxia

edit: NVM

var clickHandler = { 
	init : function() {
		if(!document.getElementById ||
			!document.createElement ||
			!document.getElementsByTagName) {
			return;
		}
		var current = document.getElementsByTagName("a");
		for(j = 0; j < current.length; j++) {
			addEvent(current[j], "click", this.clicked);
		}
	},
	clicked : function(e) {
		alert(e);
	}
};
function pageLoader() {
	clickHandler.init();
}

function addEvent(obj, evType, fn, useCapture) {
	if(obj.addEventListener) {
		obj.addEventListener(evType, fn, useCapture);
		return true;
	} else if(obj.attachEvent) {
		var r = obj.attachEvent("on" + evType, fn);
		return r;
	} else {
		alert("Handler could not be created");
	}
}

addEvent(window, "load", pageLoader);
